verses.verse: These<WH428> are also<WH1571> proverbs<WH4912> of Solomon,<WH8010> which<WH834> the men<WH582> of Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> copied<WH6275> out.
It is the glory<WH3519> of God<WH430> to conceal<WH5641> a thing:<WH1697> but the honor<WH3519> of kings<WH4428> is to search<WH2713> out a matter.<WH1697>
The heaven<WH8064> for height,<WH7312> and the earth<WH776> for depth,<WH6012> and the heart<WH3820> of kings<WH4428> is unsearchable.<WH369> <WH2714>
Take<WH1898> away<WH1898> the dross<WH5509> from the silver,<WH3701> and there shall come<WH3318> forth<WH3318> a vessel<WH3627> for the finer.<WH6884>
Take<WH1898> away<WH1898> the wicked<WH7563> from before<WH6440> the king,<WH4428> and his throne<WH3678> shall be established<WH3559> in righteousness.<WH6664>
Put<WH1921> not forth<WH1921> yourself in the presence<WH6440> of the king,<WH4428> and stand<WH5975> not in the place<WH4725> of great<WH1419> men:

For better<WH2896> it is that it be said<WH559> to you, Come<WH5927> up here;<WH2008> than that you should be put lower<WH8213> in the presence<WH6440> of the prince<WH5081> whom<WH834> your eyes<WH5869> have seen.<WH7200>

Go<WH3318> not forth<WH3318> hastily<WH4118> to strive,<WH7378> lest<WH6435> you know not what<WH4100> to do<WH6213> in the end<WH319> thereof, when your neighbor<WH7453> has put you to shame.<WH3637>
Debate<WH7378> your cause<WH7379> with your neighbor<WH7453> himself; and discover<WH1540> not a secret<WH5475> to another:<WH312>
Lest<WH6435> he that hears<WH8085> it put you to shame,<WH2616> and your infamy<WH1681> turn<WH7725> not away.
A word<WH1697> fitly<WH5921> <WH655> spoken<WH1696> is like apples<WH8598> of gold<WH2091> in pictures<WH4906> of silver.<WH3701>
As an earring<WH5141> of gold,<WH2091> and an ornament<WH2481> of fine gold,<WH3800> so<WH3651> is a wise<WH2450> reprover<WH3198> on an obedient<WH8085> ear.<WH241>

As the cold<WH6793> of snow<WH7950> in the time<WH3117> of harvest,<WH7105> so<WH3651> is a faithful<WH539> messenger<WH6735> to them that send<WH7971> him: for he refreshes<WH7725> the soul<WH5315> of his masters.<WH113>
Whoever<WH376> <WH834> boasts<WH1984> himself of a false<WH8267> gift<WH4991> is like clouds<WH5387> and wind<WH7307> without<WH369> rain.<WH1653>
By long<WH753> forbearing<WH639> is a prince<WH7101> persuaded,<WH6601> and a soft<WH7390> tongue<WH3956> breaks<WH7665> the bone.<WH1634>
Have you found<WH4672> honey?<WH1706> eat<WH398> so<WH3651> much<WH1767> as is sufficient<WH1767> for you, lest<WH6435> you be filled<WH7646> therewith, and vomit<WH6958> it.
Withdraw<WH3365> your foot<WH7272> from your neighbor's<WH7453> house;<WH1004> lest<WH6435> he be weary<WH7646> of you, and so<WH3651> hate<WH8130> you.
A man<WH376> that bears<WH6030> false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> against his neighbor<WH7453> is a maul,<WH4650> and a sword,<WH2719> and a sharp<WH8150> arrow.<WH2671>
Confidence<WH4009> in an unfaithful<WH898> man in time<WH3117> of trouble<WH6869> is like a broken<WH7465> tooth,<WH8127> and a foot<WH7272> out of joint.<WH4154>

As he that takes<WH5710> away<WH5710> a garment<WH899> in cold<WH7135> weather,<WH3117> and as vinegar<WH2558> on nitre,<WH5427> so<WH3651> is he that singes<WH7891> songs<WH7892> to an heavy<WH7451> heart.<WH3820>
If<WH518> your enemy<WH8130> be hungry,<WH7456> give him bread<WH3899> to eat;<WH398> and if<WH518> he be thirsty,<WH6771> give him water<WH4325> to drink:<WH8248>
For you shall heap<WH2846> coals<WH1513> of fire on his head,<WH7218> and the LORD<WH3068> shall reward<WH7999> you.
The north<WH6828> wind<WH7307> drives<WH2342> away rain:<WH1653> so<WH3651> does an angry<WH2194> countenance<WH6440> a backbiting<WH5643> tongue.<WH3956>
It is better<WH2896> to dwell<WH3427> in the corner<WH6438> of the housetop,<WH1406> than with a brawling<WH4090> woman<WH802> and in a wide<WH2267> house.<WH1004>
As cold<WH7119> waters<WH4325> to a thirsty soul,<WH5315> so<WH3651> is good<WH2896> news<WH8052> from a far<WH4801> country.<WH776>
A righteous<WH6662> man falling<WH4131> down before<WH6440> the wicked<WH7563> is as a troubled<WH7515> fountain,<WH4599> and a corrupt<WH7843> spring.<WH4726>
It is not good<WH2896> to eat<WH398> much<WH7235> honey:<WH1706> so<WH3651> for men to search<WH2714> their own glory<WH3519> is not glory.<WH3519>
He that has no<WH369> rule<WH4623> over his own spirit<WH7307> is like a city<WH5892> that is broken<WH6555> down, and without<WH369> walls.<WH2346>
